clusters.title: Officer Adopts Abandoned Dog Rescued at Las Vegas Airport
clusters.summary: A goldendoodle abandoned at a Las Vegas airport has found a new home with the officer who rescued him after his previous owner was arrested for abuse. Officer Skeeter Black has taken the dog in, providing him with a loving environment and a second chance at life. This heartwarming story highlights the bond between animals and their rescuers, showcasing compassion in action.

items.title: Abandoned Las Vegas Airport Dog Finds a Forever Home with the Officer Who Saved Him
items.description:
A little goldendoodle has a brighter future ahead of him after abusive treatment by his owner saw her arrested, and an officer leap at the chance to adopt. The story must, unfortunately, include some rather ugly details before one can salute Officer Skeeter Black for his compassion towards animals. It begins on February 2nd at […]

clusters.title: Pursuing Physics Beyond Talent: Wisdom From a Self-Taught 17-Year-Old
clusters.summary: At age three, Prosper Chanda was solving simple algebraic equations. At age ten, he questioned major physics theories and tested methods. “If nothing worked, I closed the book and went for a walk.

items.title: Pursuing Physics Beyond Talent: Wisdom From a Self-Taught 17-Year-Old
items.description: At age three, Prosper Chanda was solving simple algebraic equations. At age ten, he questioned major physics theories and tested methods. “If nothing worked, I closed the book and went for a walk. I kept thinking as I walked. Then I slept. Often I woke with a clearer solution. The mind needs space before it recognizes structure.” Because of his youth, Prosper was not taken seriously, and that led to isolation. He does not believe he is more talented than others. He believes in persistence and consistency. “Passion is not something you wait for. It is something you pursue the moment you recognize it.” He founded Genius Hub, a global research initiative for young people around the world because, “Research should not be limited by age.”

clusters.title: Beavers Return to Scotland's Glen Affric After 400 Years
clusters.summary: Scotland’s Glen Affric National Nature Reserve, home to ancient Caledonian pine trees, gorgeous lochs, and magnificent hiking trails, is now home to seven beavers, a homecoming for a species that disappeared four centuries ago. Forestry and Land Scotland, working alongside the charity Trees for Life, released a family of five and a breeding pair of beavers at two sites in October, 2025. Apart from their work as ecosystem "engineers", the beavers are drawing visitors and boosting local economies.

items.title: Beavers Return to Scotland's Glen Affric After 400 Years
items.description: Scotland’s Glen Affric National Nature Reserve, home to ancient Caledonian pine trees, gorgeous lochs, and magnificent hiking trails, is now home to seven beavers, a homecoming for a species that disappeared four centuries ago. Forestry and Land Scotland, working alongside the charity Trees for Life, released a family of five and a breeding pair of beavers at two sites in October, 2025. Apart from their work as ecosystem "engineers", the beavers are drawing visitors and boosting local economies. "Beaver safaris" in places like Perthshire are often booked to capacity. A single reintroduction site could eventually inject an estimated £2 million—roughly $2.7 million—into the local economy each year. In a world where we often hear about what we're losing, the return of the beaver after 400 years is a powerful reminder of what we can regain.
